meanings.definition: A garment, especially a robe or gown.
meanings.sent1: She wore a cozy tog to stay warm during the winter.
meanings.sent2: The princess put on her elegant tog for the royal ball.
meanings.sent3: The tog was so fluffy, it made her look like a walking cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her tog was like a shield against the chilly wind.
meanings.sent5: The colorful tog stood out in the sea of plain outfits.

meanings.sent1: He needed to tog up in his best suit for the job interview.
meanings.sent2: She would tog herself in layers before going out in the snow.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to tog itself in a tiny sweater, but it was too small.
meanings.sent4: Togging up in confidence, she walked into the room with a smile.
meanings.sent5: Before the race, the athletes would tog up in their team uniforms.

meanings.definition: A unit of thermal resistance used to measure the warmth of a garment.
meanings.sent1: The winter coat had a high tog rating to keep out the cold.
meanings.sent2: She checked the tog of the blanket to ensure it would be cozy enough.
meanings.sent3: The tog number on the label helped her choose the right duvet.
meanings.sent4: The tog scale made it easy to compare the warmth of different jackets.
meanings.sent5: The tog value indicated how well the sleeping bag would insulate.
